content.webTitle: Championship roundup: Brentford now third; Jay Tabb shines for Ipswich

fields.headline: Championship roundup: Brentford now third; Jay Tabb shines for Ipswich
fields.bodyText: Cardiff City 2-3 Brentford Mark Warburton rejected suggestions that Brentford are not big enough to compete in the Premier League after another impressive win left them third. “I use Burnley as an example. I know Sean Dyche well and they were a team who had one of the smaller budgets in the division, but did magnificently well. Everyone said Burnley worked hard and they were committed and no one spoke about their quality. The same goes for us.” Russell Slade said: “We have to be more ruthless in both boxes. We need to be consistent and care for 90 minutes. I can only apologise to the fans for the first half.” Ipswich 2-0 Middlesbrough Aitor Karanka slammed his players’ attitude after a poor defeat to fellow promotion contenders Ipswich. “This is the first time I have been angry. After last week’s win against Derby we thought we were a Champions League team. But today it is impossible to take anything from this. Ipswich wanted it more than us – it’s difficult to understand.” Mick McCarthy said: “The two real bits of quality came from us. Jay Tabb’s goal was awesome … He could have left in the summer, but he said he wanted to stay and I am delighted he has. His attitude has been fantastic.” And the rest … Steven Whittaker’s late equaliser for Norwich in a 2-2 draw stopped Derby going top. ■ Jordan Rhodes struck twice as Blackburn’s 2-0 victory extended Charlton’s winless run. ■ Kit Symons’s Fulham side cruised to a 4-0 win over Sheffield Wednesday. ■ David Cotterill’s free-kick gave rejuvenated Birmingham a 1-0 win at Huddersfield. ■ Rotherham earned their first win in 10 matches, 2-1 at fellow strugglers Wigan. ■ Danny Batth hit a late equaliser as Wolves drew 1-1 with Brighton. ■ And Nottingham Forest were held to a 1-1 draw by Leeds.
